title: MCP git server configured but unused and redundant with native Bash git
why_it_matters: The git MCP server is configured in .mcp.json but (a) not listed in enabledMcpjsonServers, (b) has zero references in any skill or hook, and (c) duplicates native git CLI via Bash. It adds startup overhead if ever enabled and creates confusion about which git interface to use.
suggested_fix: Remove the 'git' entry from .mcp.json mcpServers since all git operations use Bash(git ...) natively.
acceptance_tests: grep -r 'mcp__git__' .claude/ returns no results (confirms no dependents)

title: MCP memory server configured but not enabled — 3 skills have dead mcp__memory__ code paths
why_it_matters: The memory server is in .mcp.json but missing from enabledMcpjsonServers in settings.local.json. Three skills (save-context, audit-enhancements, pr-retro) reference mcp__memory__ tools that will silently fail. Either enable it or remove dead references.
suggested_fix: Decision needed: (1) Add 'memory' to enabledMcpjsonServers if memory persistence is wanted, OR (2) Remove mcp__memory__ references from the 3 skills and delete the memory entry from .mcp.json.
acceptance_tests: Either memory is in enabledMcpjsonServers and tools work, OR all mcp__memory__ references removed from skills
No silent failures when running save-context, audit-enhancements, or pr-retro skills

title: MCP filesystem server duplicates native Claude Code Read/Write/Glob/Grep tools
why_it_matters: The filesystem MCP server provides list_directory, read_file, directory_tree etc. but Claude Code has native Read, Write, Edit, Glob, Grep tools that are faster (no MCP serialization overhead) and more capable. The server consumes a process slot, adds startup latency, and 7 filesystem MCP tools are pre-approved in settings.local.json permissions despite zero skill references.
suggested_fix: Remove 'filesystem' from .mcp.json and enabledMcpjsonServers. Remove the 7 mcp__filesystem__* permission entries from settings.local.json. Use native Read/Write/Glob/Grep instead.
acceptance_tests: No skill or hook depends on mcp__filesystem__ tools

title: MCP github server enabled but not configured in .mcp.json — likely plugin-only, redundant with gh CLI
why_it_matters: 'github' is listed in enabledMcpjsonServers but has no entry in .mcp.json. It may work via the Claude plugin system, but zero skills reference mcp__github__ tools. All GitHub operations use gh CLI via Bash (gh pr view, gh run list, etc.). The enabled entry is either stale or redundant.
suggested_fix: Remove 'github' from enabledMcpjsonServers since no skills use mcp__github__ tools and gh CLI covers all GitHub operations.

title: 7 mcp__filesystem__ permissions approved in settings.local.json for unused server
why_it_matters: settings.local.json has 7 pre-approved mcp__filesystem__* permissions (list_directory, directory_tree, read_text_file, read_multiple_files, get_file_info, list_allowed_directories, list_directory_with_sizes inferred). These bloat the permissions list and could be confusing since native tools should be preferred.
suggested_fix: Remove all mcp__filesystem__* entries from settings.local.json permissions.allow array.
acceptance_tests: No mcp__filesystem__* entries in settings.local.json permissions.allow
Permissions array is shorter and cleaner

title: 3 mcp__serena__ permissions approved but serena is in disabledMcpjsonServers
why_it_matters: settings.local.json has 3 approved mcp__serena__ permissions (list_dir, get_current_config, activate_project) but serena is explicitly disabled in settings.json disabledMcpjsonServers. These permissions are dead entries that add clutter.
suggested_fix: Remove all mcp__serena__* entries from settings.local.json permissions.allow array.
acceptance_tests: No mcp__serena__* entries in settings.local.json permissions.allow

title: MCP global template (.claude/mcp.global-template.json) includes puppeteer which conflicts with playwright
why_it_matters: The global MCP template suggests puppeteer for browser automation, but the project uses playwright MCP server for all browser testing (test-suite skill, 15+ tool references). If a user follows the template and installs both, they get two competing browser automation servers consuming resources.
suggested_fix: Update mcp.global-template.json to suggest playwright instead of puppeteer, matching the actual project configuration.

title: MCP firebase server enabled but not configured — may rely on plugin auto-discovery
why_it_matters: 'firebase' is in enabledMcpjsonServers but has no entry in .mcp.json. Three mcp__firebase__ permissions exist in settings.local.json. If this relies on plugin auto-discovery it works but is fragile. If it is stale configuration from a removed server, it adds confusion.
suggested_fix: Either add firebase server configuration to .mcp.json for explicit setup, or verify it works via plugin and document that dependency.
acceptance_tests: Firebase MCP tools either work reliably or are removed from enabledMcpjsonServers
Configuration is explicit rather than implicit
